intro: Acuan fallax, commonly known as the false mignonette, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of white or pale pink flowers. Acuan fallax is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
